text: {| class="wikitable floatright" style="font-size: 0.9em; width: 270px;" |+ Minor planets discovered: 20 |- | see |} Artyom Olegovich Novichonok (; born 27 March 1988 in Kondopoga, Soviet Union (now Russia) is a Russian astronomer. Since 2009, the Minor Planet Center credits him with several minor planets, co-discovered in collaboration with astronomers Dmitry Chestnov, Vladimir Gerke and Leonid Elenin at the American Tzec Maun Observatory in Mayhill, New Mexico, and the Russian Ka-Dar Observatory , TAU Station, in Nizhny Arkhyz, respectively. He also discovered the periodic comet P/2011 R3 (Novichonok) in 2011, and he was part of the group that discovered the hyperbolic Comet ISON in September 2012, with Vitaly Nevsky at Kondopoga, Russia. == Discoveries == Comet ISON viewed by TRAPPIST in 2013 === Comets === Together with Vitali Neveski, he discovered the comets: * C/2012 S1 (Comet ISON), a hyperbolic cometProfile at Petrozavodsk State University * P/2011 R3 (Novichonok), a Jupiter-family comet === List of discovered minor planets === {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 89%; float: left; width: 26em; margin- right: 1em; height: 336px; |- | 228165 Mezentsev || 26 September 2009 || |- | 231649 Korotkiy || 17 November 2009 || |- | || 17 November 2009 || |- | || 25 November 2009 || |- | 274981 Petrsu || 12 October 2009 || |- | || 17 December 2009 || |- | || 17 October 2009 || |- | || 17 November 2009 || |- | || 17 October 2009 || |- | || 17 November 2009 || |- | || 28 September 2011 || |- | || 18 November 2009 || |} {| class="wikitable" style="font- size: 89%; float: left; width: 26em; margin-right: 1em; height: 336px; |- | || 16 October 2010 || |- | || 9 November 2009 || |- | || 18 October 2009 || |- | || 20 November 2009 || |- | || 21 November 2009 || |- | || 9 January 2010 || |- | || 9 November 2009 || |- | || 11 January 2010 || |- ! colspan=3 style="font-weight: normal; text-align: left; padding: 4px 12px;" |Co- discovery made with: D. Chestnov V. Gerke L.
